snippet: After a 2006 court ruling, the state, in 2007, agreed to give $7 billion in additional aid to schools, but the entire amount did not materialize.
abstract: New Yorkers for Students’ Educational Rights announces plan to file lawsuit in State Supreme Court in Manhattan, contending that New York State has shortchanged entire public school system by billions of dollars by ignoring 2006 court ruling that state had to increase school spending in New York City; suit comes amid raging debate over how to pay for prekindergarten in New York.
lead_paragraph: After a 2006 court ruling, the state, in 2007, agreed to give $7 billion in additional aid to schools, but the entire amount did not materialize.

headline.main: Suit Will Seek State Money Promised to Schools in 2007
headline.print_headline: Suit Will Seek State Money Promised to Schools in 2007

keywords.value: New Yorkers for Students' Educational Rights
keywords.name: organizations
